content.raw:
You are correct that when creating a publisher you have to specify the type. We have never used self-describing messages before, so there is no mechanism to determine if a message is self-describing or not. You could add logic to gazebo transport system to check for self-describing messages. I haven't looked into the feasibility of this. I think it would require some experimentation.

Alternatively, you could use [Ignition Transport](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport). This is transport is used by parts of gazebo9, and is the transport system for our current development efforts. You can use ignition transport in conjunction with gazebo's legacy transport system, and the API looks very similar. I bring up this option because you can echo topics without using self-describing messages.
